DataElement.preferredName: Local Induration/Swelling Injectable Product-Related Reaction Occurrence Measurement Centimeter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric centimeter value to represent the measurement of the local induration/swelling associated to the reaction to the injectable product.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Local Induration/Swelling Injectable Product-Related Reaction Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality._The quality of being hard, the process of hardening, or an abnormally hard spot or place, particularly of the skin._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Enlargement; expansion in size; sign of inflammation._A reaction to the injection of a pharmacological or biological substance._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Local Induration And/Or Swelling Injectable Product-Related Reaction
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.:The quality of being hard, the process of hardening, or an abnormally hard spot or place, particularly of the skin.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Enlargement; expansion in size; sign of inflammation:A reaction to the injection of a pharmacological or biological substance.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
The quality of being hard, the process of hardening, or an abnormally hard spot or place, particularly of the skin.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Enlargement; expansion in size; sign of inflammation
A reaction to the injection of a pharmacological or biological substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.:The quality of being hard, the process of hardening, or an abnormally hard spot or place, particularly of the skin.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Enlargement; expansion in size; sign of inflammation:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
The quality of being hard, the process of hardening, or an abnormally hard spot or place, particularly of the skin.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Enlargement; expansion in size; sign of inflammation
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Approved and released. 2021-4-23 ak; Created for NCI-INC0574290 - Reactogenicity Grading Scale Tables 000115. 2021-4-22 ak

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard._A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.:A centimeter is a basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Approved and released. 2021-4-23 ak Created for NCI-INC0574290 - Reactogenicity Grading Scale Tables 000115. 2021-4-22 ak
